Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.name: numberOfSectionsInDataGridView(_:)
Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.abstract: Count of sections to display in the data grid.

Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.name: numberOfColumnsInDataGridView(_:)
Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.abstract: Count of columns to display in the data grid.

Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.name: columnGroupingsForDataGridView(_:)
Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.abstract: The grouping settings to use for the data grid. Expects an array of grouped column index sets for the first and last column index

Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.name: dataGridView(_:numberOfRowsInSection:)
Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.abstract: Number of rows to display in the provided data grid section.

Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.name: dataGridView(_:numberOfFrozenRowsInSection:)
Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.abstract: Number of frozen rows in the provided section. Frozen rows start from the top and will be “frozen” in place and not scroll vertically out of view.

Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.name: numberOfFrozenColumnsInDataGridView(_:)
Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.abstract: Number of frozen columns in the data grid. Frozen columns start from the left and will be “frozen” in place and not scroll horizontally out of view.

Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.name: dataGridView(_:cellAtIndexPath:)
Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.abstract: Return the cell content to be displayed in the data grid for the provided indexPath.

Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.name: dataGridView(_:gridHeaderViewForColumn:)
Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.abstract: Return the header view to be displayed in the provided column.

Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.name: dataGridView(_:groupedHeaderViewFor:at:)
Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.abstract: Return the header view to be displayed in the provided column grouping

Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.name: dataGridView(_:gridFooterViewForColumn:)
Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.abstract: Number of sections to display in the data grid

Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.name: dataGridView(_:sectionHeaderCellAtIndexPath:)
Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.abstract: Number of sections to display in the data grid

Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.name: dataGridView(_:sectionFooterCellAtIndexPath:)
Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html#/.abstract: Number of sections to display in the data grid

Protocols/SwiftGridReusableViewDelegate..abstract: Called when the reusable view is deselected.

Protocols/SwiftGridReusableViewDelegate..abstract: Called when the reusable view is highlighted.

Protocols/SwiftGridReusableViewDelegate..abstract: Called when the reusable view is unhighlighted.

Protocols/SwiftGridReusableViewDelegate..name: SwiftGridReusableViewDelegate
Protocols/SwiftGridReusableViewDelegate..abstract: The SwiftGridReusableViewDelegate is used for passing selection and highlighting events through to the data grid.

Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html.name: SwiftGridViewDataSource
Protocols/SwiftGridViewDataSource.html.abstract: The SwiftGridViewDataSource protocol is used much like a UICollectionView or UITableView data source for retrieving all data needed to display the data grid.

Protocols/SwiftGridViewDelegate.html.name: SwiftGridViewDelegate
Protocols/SwiftGridViewDelegate.html.abstract: The SwiftGridViewDelegate protocol is used much like a UICollectionView or UITableView delegate for handling interactions and sizing of the data grid.

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/c:@M@SwiftGr.name: collectionView
Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/c:@M@SwiftGr.abstract: Internal Collectionview. Open to allow for custom interaction, modify at own risk.

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.name: allowsSelection
Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: Enable or disable selection for the entire gridview.

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.name: allowsMultipleSelection
Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: When enabled, multiple cells can be selected. If row selection is enabled, then multiple rows can be selected.

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.name: rowSelectionEnabled
Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: If row selection is enabled, then entire rows will be selected rather than individual cells. This applies to section headers/footers in addition to rows.

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.name: isDirectionalLockEnabled
Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: When directional lock is enabled, the grid is only scrollable in one direction at a time (vertically or horizontally)

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.name: bounces
Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: Enables bouncing for the gridvies

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.name: stickySectionHeaders
Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: Determines whether section headers will stick while scrolling vertically or scroll off screen.

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.name: alwaysBounceVertical
Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: default NO. if YES and bounces is YES, even if content is smaller than bounds, allow drag vertically

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.name: alwaysBounceHorizontal
Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: default NO. if YES and bounces is YES, even if content is smaller than bounds, allow drag horizontally

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.name: showsHorizontalScrollIndicator
Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: A Boolean value that controls whether the horizontal scroll indicator is visible.

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.name: showsVerticalScrollIndicator
Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: A Boolean value that controls whether the vertical scroll indicator is visible.

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.name: pinchExpandEnabled
Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: Pinch to expand increases the size of the columns. Experimental feature.

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.name: scrollsToTop
Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: Whether or not the gridView will automatically scroll to top when the status bar is tapped. Default is YES.

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.name: refreshControl
Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.name: reloadData()
Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: Reloads all data for the SwiftGridView

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.name: reloadCellsAtIndexPaths(_:animated:)
Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: Reloads the specified items by their indexPath(s).

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.name: reloadCellsAtIndexPaths(_:animated:completion:)
Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: Reloads the specified items by their indexPath(s).

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: Get the item indexPath based on the provided point

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.name: indexPath(for:)
Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: Get the item indexPath for the provided cell

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.name: cellForItem(at:)
Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: Get the cell for the provided indexPath

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: Scroll to the cell at the provided indexPath. If the cell scroll posiition would not fit without pushing the grid outside of its normal scroll bounds, the position wil be the closest compatible

Classes/SwiftGridView.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: Manually set the content offset for the gridview

Classes/SwiftGridReusableView.html#/s:13.name: highlighted
Classes/SwiftGridReusableView.html#/s:13.abstract: Views become highlighted when the user touches them.

Classes/SwiftGridReusableView.html#/s:13.name: contentView
Classes/SwiftGridReusableView.html#/s:13.abstract: Add custom subviews to the reusable view’s content view.

Classes/SwiftGridReusableView.html#/c:@M.name: backgroundView
Classes/SwiftGridReusableView.html#/c:@M.abstract: The background view is a subview behind all other views.

Classes/SwiftGridReusableView.html#/c:@M.name: selectedBackgroundView
Classes/SwiftGridReusableView.html#/c:@M.abstract: The selectedBackgroundView will be placed above the background view and displayed on view selection.

Classes/SwiftGridReusableView.html#/s:13.name: reuseIdentifier()
Classes/SwiftGridReusableView.html#/s:13.abstract: Returns the reuse identifier string to be used for the cell. Override to provide a custom identifier.

Classes/SwiftGridReusableView.html#/c:@M.name: prepareForReuse()
Classes/SwiftGridReusableView.html#/c:@M.abstract: Called before instance is returned from the reuse queue.

Classes/SwiftGridCell.html#/s:13SwiftGri.name: reuseIdentifier()
Classes/SwiftGridCell.html#/s:13SwiftGri.abstract: Returns the reuse identifier string to be used for the cell. Override to provide a custom identifier.

Classes/SwiftGridCell.html.name: SwiftGridCell
Classes/SwiftGridCell.html.abstract: SwiftGridCell is the base cell type used by the SwiftGridView class. This class inherits from UICollectionViewCell and doesn’t currently have much further funcitonality.

Classes/SwiftGridReusableView.html.name: SwiftGridReusableView
Classes/SwiftGridReusableView.html.abstract: SwiftGridReusableView is the primary reusable view used for headers and footers in the SwiftGridView

Classes/SwiftGridView.html.name: SwiftGridView
Classes/SwiftGridView.html.abstract: SwiftGridView is the primary view class, utilizing a UICollectionView and a custom layout handler.
